tasks.task: Engage local farmers in training workshops on vegetable grafting for climate-smart agriculture.
subtasks: Deliver theoretical lectures on local grafting research (various rootstocks for tomatoes and sweet peppers).
Present findings on grafting's impact on biotic and abiotic stress resistance.
Explain how vegetable grafting reduces financial losses and pesticide use.
Illustrate the potential for increased food security through successful crop protection.

tasks.task: Facilitate farmer adoption of IPM (Integrated Pest Management) practices.
subtasks: Educate farmers on using vegetable grafting as the first line of defense against soil-borne diseases.
Highlight the contrast between grafting and immediate chemical intervention, emphasizing lower costs and higher success rates.
Showcase positive farmer feedback and practical application of learned grafting techniques.
